content.content: In the US more than 75,000 babies and children get severe sepsis a year. More children die from sepsis than from cancer.[^163] Embedded content: https://youtu.be/GU2oiAczTq8 Embedded content: https://youtu.be/cypQFXPrQD4 Sepsis is the body's extreme and __life-threatening overreaction__ to an infection. The body attacks itself and can cause tissue damage, organ failure, amputations and death.[^86] ## Neonatal Sepsis Neonatal Sepsis is when babies that are younger than 3 months get sepsis. ### Risk Factors: - Group B Streptococcus exposure during mom's pregnancy - Premature birth - Ruptured membranes (water breaks) more than 18 hours before delivery - IV catheters - Long hospital stay - Exposure to sick people - Infection of the placenta and amniotic fluid[^164][^165] ### Signs & Symptoms: - High or low temperature - Difficulty breathing - Diarrhea - Poor sucking - Cold hands &/or feet - Seizures - Swollen belly - Vomiting - Yellow skin and eyes - Dry diapers for more than 12 hours - Clammy, pale &/or strangely colored skin[^165] Babies may be too young for the recommended vaccinations for the following diseases: - Rubella (German measles) - Varicella (Chicken pox) - Haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) ### Common Infections: - Respiratory synctial virus (RSV) - Cytomegalovirus (CMV) - E. Coli - Candida - Herpes simplex virus (HSV) - Listeria monocytogenes[^165] ## Sepsis in Children ### Risk Factors: - Infected wounds or cuts - Urinary tract infection - Pneumonia - Ear infections - Meningitis[^165] ### Signs & Symptoms: - Fast heart rate - Sleepy, confused or difficult to wake - Severe pain - High or low temperature (fever &/or chills) - Shortness of breath - Pale or discolored skin - Feeling very sick - Low blood pressure - Increase or decrease in white blood cells[^165] ### Prevention: - Childhood vaccinations - Handwashing - Keeping cuts or wounds clean & covered[^165] __Use the Hospital Plan of Care form to advocate and ask questions about your loved one.__ [The Hospital Plan of Care form](https://patientsafetymovement.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/POC-Blank-April-19.pdf "The Hospital Plan of Care form") [Guide to Medical Care at a Distance](https://patientsafetymovement.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Guide-to-Medical-Care-at-a-Distance.pdf "Guide to Medical Care at a Distance") ## Post-Sepsis Syndrome (PSS) Embedded content: https://youtu.be/HIk64wdy44Q __Fifty percent (50%) of Sepsis survivors suffer from Post-Sepsis Syndrome.__[^87] ### New Physical Challenges: - Fatigue and weakness - Muscle &/or joint pain - Amputation - Increased risk for infection - Shortness of breath - Dressing, grooming, walking, & feeding difficulties[^87],[^88] ### New Mental Issues: - Depression, anxiety, &/or PTSD (Post-traumatic stress syndrome) - Poor memory or slow thinking - Difficulty concentrating - Difficulty sleeping, nightmares, &/or insomnia - Panic attacks - Hallucinations[^87],[^88] ### Prevention: - Early mobilization - [ICU Diary](http://www.icu-diary.org/diary/Diary.html "ICU Diary") - Family/Caregiver support and engagement[^89],[^90] ### Treatments & Support: - Physical, Occupational, &/or Speech therapy - Psychological therapy, counseling, &/or neuropsychological testing - Follow up health care provider &/or specialist appointments - Medication review & education by health care provider[^87],[^88] [Sepsis and Children from the Sepsis Alliance](https://www.sepsis.org/sepsisand/children/) [Neonatal sepsis from MedlinePlus](https://medlineplus.gov/ency/article/007303.htm) [Post-Sepsis Syndrome](https://www.sepsis.org/sepsis-basics/post-sepsis-syndrome/ "Post-Sepsis Syndrome") [^86]: The Rory Staunton Foundation. Sepsis fact sheet. [Sepsis Fact Sheet](https://rorystauntonfoundationforsepsis.org/sepsis-fact-sheet/ "Sepsis Fact Sheet") Accessed May 20, 2020. [^87]: Sepsis Alliance. Post-Sepsis Syndrome. Accessed March 8, 2020. [https://www.sepsis.org/sepsis-basics/post-sepsis-syndrome/](https://www.sepsis.org/sepsis-basics/post-sepsis-syndrome/) [^88]: Prescott HC, Angus DC. Postsepsis morbidity. *JAMA.* 2018;319(1):91. doi:10.1001/jama.2017.19809.[https://jamanetwork.com/journals/jama/fullarticle/2667724](https://jamanetwork.com/journals/jama/fullarticle/2667724) Accessed March 8, 2020." [^89]: Parker AM, Sricharoenchai T, & Needham DM. Early rehabilitation in the intensive care unit: Preventing impairment of physical and mental health. Curr Phys Med Rehabil Rep 1, 307–314 (2013). Accessed April 10, 2020. https://doi.org/10.1007/s40141-013-0027-9. [^90]: Davidson JE, Aslakson RA, Long AC, Puntillo KA, Kross EK, Hart J, et al. . Guidelines for family-centered care in the neonatal, pediatric, and adult ICU. Crit Care Med. (2017) 45:103–28. doi.org/10.1097/CCM.0000000000002169. Accessed April 10, 2020. [^163]: Hartman M, Linde-Zwirble W, Angus D, Watson RS. Trends in the epidemiology of pediatric severe sepsis. Pediatr Crit Care Med. 2013;14(7):686-693. doi: 10.1097/PCC.0b013e3182917fad. Accessed September 28, 2018. [^164]: U.S National Library. Neonatal sepsis. MedlinePlus website. https://medlineplus.gov/ency/article/007303.htm. Updated October 1, 2018. Accessed October 1, 2018. [^165]: Sepsis Alliance. Sepsis and Children. https://www.sepsis.org/sepsisand/children/. Updated December 13, 2017. Accessed September 27, 2018.
